definition: tool/device/utensil/equipment/instrument/talent/ability/to possess/to have/to provide/to furnish/to state/classifier for devices, coffins, dead bodies

sentences.english: No man loves his fetters be they made of gold.
sentences.chinese: 即使腳鐐黃金鑄，無人愛上這刑具。

sentences.english: These cruel devices are designed to stop prisoners bending their legs.
sentences.chinese: 這些殘酷的刑具是用來阻止犯人彎腿的。

sentences.english: It is alleged that prisoners were routinely mistreated at the facility.
sentences.chinese: 它被控告用刑具每天虐待囚犯。

sentences.english: Jesus died on a very painful Roman death machine to bring us life.
sentences.chinese: 耶穌死於痛苦的羅馬刑具上好讓我們可以得到生命。

sentences.english: The telephone becomes an instrument of torture in the demonic hands of a beloved who doesn't ring.
sentences.chinese: 心上人不給我打電話，電話成了她魔手中的一件刑具。

sentences.english: Different torture devices mete out different kinds of punishment.

definition: to squeeze the fingers (old form of torture)

tiger bench (torture method in which the victim sits with legs extended horizontally along a bench, upper legs held down with straps while bricks are inserted under the feet, forcing the knee joint to bend in reverse)
the hot pillar (ancient Chinese torture instrument)
prisoner that awaits execution/convict sentenced to death/someone on death row
sticks used for squeezing the fingers (old form of torture)
to beat a prisoner (to obtain confessions)/to give sb the third degree/to torture
beating with wooden staves (as corporal punishment)
